references.paper_title: Cross-domain contrastive learning for unsupervised domain adaptation
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the topic of domain adaptation, which is the central theme of the main paper, and provides a novel approach using contrastive learning.
This foundational paper introduced the concept of domain-adversarial training which is a key technique used and improved upon in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Moment matching for multi-source domain adaptation
references.reason: This work is crucial as it tackles multi-source domain adaptation which is directly addressed and extended by the main paper.

references.paper_title: Blending-target domain adaptation by adversarial meta-adaptation networks
references.reason: This paper focuses on blended-target domain adaptation (BTDA), which is the specific domain adaptation problem that is improved upon in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Class overwhelms: Mutual conditional blended-target domain adaptation
references.reason: This paper provides a recent state-of-the-art approach to BTDA that the main paper builds upon and improves.
